numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Legacy and money make a big difference in acceptance.
2. If an applicant has no legacy at a school then the chance of acceptance by an elite school is low.
3. If the parents of an applicant do not have a high income then the chance of acceptance by an elite school is low.
4. However, an applicant without legacy can be accepted by an elite school.
5. However, an applicant with parents without a high income can be accepted by an elite school.
6. I wonder why legacy is important to schools.
7. My community is composed mainly of immigrants.
8. Most people in my community have no education.
9. People in my community come from other countries.
10. Therefore, people in my community have no legacy in the country where they currently live.
11. This situation affects the children of people in my community.
12. Some children in my community want to apply to an elite college.
13. If a child in my community applies to an elite college then the chance of acceptance is slim.
14. The headline is: Legacy and money are important to elite colleges.
